results.title: Polyurethane progress
results.brief_description: A technical film dealing with research, manufacturing processes and the development of outlets for the rigid and flexible foam plastic industry. Illustrates the advanced scientific methods of production, including the moulding of foam car seats by micro-wave units, and the application of rigid foam to wall and other surfaces for insulation purposes.

results.title: Polyester
results.creator_credit: John Waters and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A comedy melodrama of the tragic life of Francine Fishpaw (Divine) an obese housewife whose mere existence burdens her so-called loved ones. Unjustly mistreated by her chauvinistic husband Elmer who runs the local porn theatre and money hungry mother, La Rue, she turns to the bottle for love and support. Life is on the downslide for the Fishpaw household with son Dexter, the reputed neighbourhood phantom foot stomper, daughter Lulu, a crazed pregnant disco groupie and the family dog resorting to suicide. Then, in a Cinderella fantasy, Francine meets her Polyester Prince, Todd Tomorrow (Tab Hunter) and blissfully, they fall in love. Has Francine finally found true meaning to life and happiness or will she return to an unsavoury lifestyle with Elmer, Dexter and Lulu? Co-starring Edith Massey, David Samson, Mary Garlington and Ken King.

results.title: Polychrome phantasy
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this early film Norman McLaren shot crystal formations through a low-power microscope, using polarized light with the lower part of the picture masked off. The film was then rewound and a scene of dancers was filmed. No dialogue or music.

results.title: Polybius
results.creator_credit: James Houston, Joanne Daly, Bold Yin and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A SEGA Mega Drive, Commodore 64, floppy disk drives and hard drives sing in unison. The unusual ensemble (controlled live via MIDI) is given a last curtain call in a nostalgic farewell to forgotten friends.

results.title: Poltergeist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tobe Hooper, Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The secure existence of an quintessentially middle-class nuclear family living in suburban California is shattered by supernatural forces in this updated haunted-house narrative produced by Spielberg in the same year he produced and directed “E.T.”. The youngest daughter, ten year old Carol Anne, is inextricably drawn to strange phenomenon that communicate via the family television and which eventually pull her through the screen into the spirit world. Though the film was directed by Tobe Hooper, it is widely considered to carry Spielburg’s trademark style in its setting, its childlike sense of wonder and horror, and its extensive use of scary special effects. Cast: Jobeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson, Beatrice Straight, Dominique Dunn, Oliver Robins, Heather O’Rourke. Written by Steven Spielberg, Michael Grais and Mark Victor. Music by Jerry Goldsmith.

results.title: Poltergeist (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tobe Hooper, Frank Marshall and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: Life is very pleasant for a Californian family until a host of other worldly forces invade their peaceful suburban home. There presence is kind of predictable, given that their house is built over a cemetery. The poltergeists takes a particular interest in their 5 year old daughter, who communicates with them through the infamous television scene (a clever about turn on the communication that another alien, ET managed to do in Spielberg’s ‘ET’). Soon their house is turned into a swirling supernatural side show. The forces at work are anything but friendly and if the luckless family doesn’t soon clear out, they’ll all be swept off into a nightmarish chaos. The dark humour of the piece manages to lift Hooper’s (‘Texas chain saw massacre’) scary tale above the horror on the screen. Cast includes Craig T Nelson, Jobeth Williams, Beatrice Straight and Dominique Dunne.

results.title: Poltergeist
results.brief_description: One of the most famous horror movies of all time follows a family trying to deal with their haunted house by calling in parapsychologists. It’s also considered a cursed film because of tragedies associated with its production.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

results.description: Steve Freeling lives with his wife, Diane, and their three children, Dana, Robbie, and Carol Anne, in Southern California where he sells houses for the company that built the neighborhood. It starts with just a few odd occurrences, such as broken dishes and furniture moving around by itself. However, when he realizes that something truly evil haunts his home, Steve calls in a team of parapsychologists led by Dr. Lesh to help before it’s too late.

results.title: Polska
results.creator_credit: David Bradbury, AFFC and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A documentary on contemporary life in and history of Poland. Shows Lech Walensa speaking in public, and has interviews with Poles about daily life in Poland. Recorded in English but contains subtitles in English for spoken Polish. Filmed in colour with some Black & White sequences.

results.title: Polo
results.brief_description:
Do nightmares come true? In a tale of a dark strange land, a silent outcast and a powerful robot, a creator will try to harness his creation.
Music by James Hodsons.
